clinical_study.brief_title: Comparative Effectiveness of Decision Aids for Stable Chest Discomfort
clinical_study.official_title: Randomized Trial Comparing Effectiveness of Two Patient Decision Aids for Stable Chest Discomfort

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of the study is to compare two different types of decision support materials for patients considering treatment for chest pain or chest discomfort from heart disease.

detailed_description.textblock: The purpose of the project is to compare the effectiveness of a detailed, video patient decision aid and an online, interactive patient decision aid for treatment of Stable Chest Discomfort. The study will randomly assign eligible participants to receive either the online decision aid or the video decision aid. Participants will complete a survey after reviewing the decision aid that will examine decision quality, use of the intervention, and satisfaction with the intervention.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Within 1 week after reviewing the decision aid
primary_outcome.description: 6 multiple choice knowledge items from the Stable Chest Discomfort decision quality instrument will be assessed and a total score (0-6) will be generated with higher scores indicating higher knowledge.

secondary_outcome.measure: Treatment leaning (percentage of patients who have a clear treatment preference)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Within 1 week after reviewing the decision aid
secondary_outcome.description: To determine the percentage of patients who have a clear treatment preference

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Within 1 week after reviewing the decision aid
secondary_outcome.description: 2 items will assess participants' satisfaction with the intervention.

arm_group.description: This group will receive the access to an online decision aid that covers the main treatment options for stable chest discomfort.
This group will receive the DVD and booklet decision aid describing stable chest discomfort and the main treatment options including medical therapy and stents.

intervention.description: The Healthwise online shared decision point for Stable Chest Discomfort
The Health Dialog DVD and booklet decision aid for Stable Chest Discomfort

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Adults 18 and older
- English speaking
- Current diagnosis of stable angina
- Ability to access online material and willing to provide an email address
Exclusion Criteria:
- Coronary bypass surgery and/or percutaneous coronary intervention within 6 months
- Diagnosis of unstable angina, acute coronary syndrome, STEMI, non STEMI within 6 months
- Scheduled for nonelective catheterization
- Significant cognitive deficit such that participant is unable to consent for self
- Serious comorbidities or other conditions that make revascularization inappropriate
